We are standing up against land grabbing. 
We are standing up against modern day slavery 
We are standing up against deforestation and climate pollution. 
We are standing in solidarity with communities in Indonesia fighting to stop the expansion of Conflict Palm Oil on their lands.

I recently visited Borneo and they are cutting down rainforest to plant palms to provide palm oil to your company. You need to find an alternative to protect the many wonderful animals that live in our rain forest and do it NOW.  I saw baby orangutans orphaned from the activity that your company is perpetuating, their mothers probably murdered when the forest was obliterated to make way for plams. Please find an alternative, I'm sure if you asked your customers they would want you to find an alternative.

What about the stories of the people and creatures living in Indonesia? It is buring right now - and PepsiCo is a part of that destruction. Pepsi, you must cut conflict Palm Oil from ALL products sold by PepsiCo right now. It is shameful that you stil engage in vast deforestation, land theft, species extinction, and child and forced labor for cheap snacks. The world is watching you Pepsi!

Pepsi -- we're watching you. Commit to a STRONG palm oil policy. http://action.sumofus.org/a/pepsico-palm-oil/ #inyourpalm

We all have a stake in stopping the destruction of the rainforest. Deforestation in Southeast Asia has made Indonesia the third largest carbon emitter in the planet. The orangutan, the Sumatran tiger, and countless other endangered species are being pushed the brink of extinction. Many workers are lured into palm oil plantations on false pretenses, and have their passports and ID’s confiscated. Investigations have found workers being beaten by “enforcers”, locked in tiny barracks at night, and not allowed to leave for any reason. Meanwhile, the remaining forests of Indonesia are storing as much carbon dioxide as the entire earth emits in a year, meaning that allowing the destruction to continue could detonate a carbon bomb.
Pepsi -- we're watching you. Commit to a STRONG palm oil policy. http://action.sumofus.org/a/pepsico-palm-oil/ #inyourpalm

Workers who are members of Indian National Trade Union Congress (INTUC) at West Bengal warehouses exclusively contracted by PepsiCo are fighting for fairness and justice in the face of mass dismissals as a result of exercising their right to join a union. 

162 workers out of 170 have been brutally fired. Furthermore PepsiCo is using labour contractors that are not officially licensed (something that is mandatory). Workers are therefore not paid the current minimum wages set since January 1, 2013 and no social security payments are made for them as required by law.

Very dear Pepsi! 
I know you earn enough money in India, that you can afford to treat your employees well!!
